column3: rectilinear building shape, linear, building with straight lines and angular shape, geometric
column4: building with completely organic curves, highly flowing lines, and very wavy shapes, non-geometric

column3: building in purely grayscale, black or white, or no color
column4: building of vivid colors, highly saturated hues and very colorful

column3: solid building, opaque building, enclosed structure, impenetrable building, no windows
column4: glazed façade, transparent edifice, see-through structure, glass wall, large windows

column3: A building with an asymmetrical design and unbalanced structure. The edifice features an irregular shape and composition, with visibly different arrangements of elements on its various sides or facades. The overall form lacks a clear central axis of symmetry, instead showcasing a dynamic and varied architectural expression.
column4: A building exhibiting perfect symmetry in its design. The structure features mirrored halves when divided vertically down the center. All visible elements, including overall form and architectural details, are precisely balanced and repeated on both sides of a central axis, creating a harmonious and ordered appearance.
